ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: there is solace and sweetness and a Garden of Delight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: There will be peace and plenty, and gardens of tranquility for him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: then happiness and delight and Gardens of Bliss are his.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: it will have rest, happiness, and a beautiful Paradise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Then is relief, and flowers – and Gardens of peace.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then Rawh, Rayhan and a Garden of Delights.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Then happiness and bounty and a garden of bliss.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: there shall be repose and ease, and a Garden of Delight;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then breath of life, and plenty, and a Garden of delight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: then for him there shall be comfort and plenty and a Garden of Bliss;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: For him shall be comfort, and fragrance and a Garden of Delight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: then ease, abundance, and a garden of bliss.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (There is for him) Rest and Satisfaction, and a Garden of Delights.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (There is for him) rest and provision, and a Garden of delights (Paradise).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: there shall be calmness and ease, a Garden of Delight.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Then happiness, and flowers, and Garden of Delights.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then [for him is] rest and bounty and a garden of pleasure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [56:89] then repose, that is, there will be for him relief, and a goodly provision, and a garden of Bliss (does this response belong to the ammā, ‘thus’, or to in, ‘if’, or to both? Different opinions [are given regarding this]).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then breath of life) then rest for them in the grave; and it is also said that this means: then there is mercy for them, (and plenty) when they come out of the grave; and it is also said this means: and provision, (and a Garden of Delight) on the Day of Judgement whose delight is perpetual.
